definition: to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: They  fired at a fleeting enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他们向正在逃跑的敌人开火。

sentences.english: See the two men to escape, Li master by telephone to the police report to the police.
sentences.chinese: 见两名男子逃跑后，李师傅借电话向警方报警。

sentences.english: At this, he instantly let me go, and I ran for my life.
sentences.chinese: 听到这话，他立刻放开了我，我于是拼命逃跑。

sentences.english: And when Sarai afflicted her, she ran away.
sentences.chinese: 于是撒辣依就虐待她，她便由撒辣依面前逃跑了。

sentences.english: And suddenly the only solution that made sense for her. Escape.
sentences.chinese: 忽然间对她来说，唯一合理的解决办法就是，逃跑。

sentences.english: Now the five kings had fled and hidden in the cave at Makkedah.
sentences.chinese: 那五王逃跑，藏在玛基大洞里。

sentences.english: Not being seen by anyone, the thief escaped.
sentences.chinese: 那个贼趁无人看见时逃跑了。

sentences.english: Sasuke is looking at the fleeing Danzo and reaches his arm out.
sentences.chinese: 佐助眼睁睁的看着团藏逃跑了。

sentences.english: The thief leaped the wall and escaped.
Seeing the police come, that rouge knotted it.
sentences.chinese: 一看到警察来，那个恶棍就逃跑了。

sentences.english: Just then the cock runs away from the fox and flies into the tree.
sentences.chinese: 就在那时，公鸡从狐狸的嘴里逃跑并飞进了树。

sentences.english: This was what he did on a full-time basis, and we do give him credit in terms of his ability to plan his activities and his escape routes.
sentences.chinese: 这使得他具备了计划行动和逃跑路线的能力。

sentences.english: So my consciousness narrows and constricts, and I'm in the "fight or flight" mode.
sentences.chinese: 我的意识变得狭窄，收紧，进入“对抗或逃跑“模式。

sentences.english: That felon tried to escape from the prison.
sentences.chinese: 那名重罪犯试图从监狱中逃跑。

sentences.english: He grabbed his children, the youngest only three, and fled.
sentences.chinese: 他拉着他的孩子们逃跑了，最小的才三岁。

sentences.english: Some of the injuries occurred during the panic, when people jumped from windows or balconies.
sentences.chinese: 有些人由于恐慌跳窗或阳台逃跑时受伤。

definition: to run away/to flee in disarray
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to run away/to take to one's heels
to hide/to evade/to dodge/to take shelter/to avoid (difficulties)
to leave in stealth/to slip away
